issue.title: ota_http component
issue.body:
# What does this implement/fix?

ota in client (http) mode: This allow to do a remote ota when the device is far away, behind a firewall, and only reachable with mqtt. (For ex in another house).

  - https only supported for esp32
  - no auth support for the moment

original component from https://github.com/oarcher/piotech/tree/main/components/ota_http

## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [X] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Other

**Related issue or feature (if applicable):** fixes <https://github.com/esphome/feature-requests/issues/801>

**Pull request in [esphome-docs](https://github.com/esphome/esphome-docs) with documentation (if applicable):** esphome/esphome-docs#3291

## Test Environment

- [X] ESP32
- [X] ESP32 IDF
- [X] ESP8266
- [ ] RP2040

### Http/Https support matrix

|   | ESP32  | ESP32 IDF   | ESP8266  | RP2040  |
|---|---|---|---|---|
|  HTTP | Yes   | Yes  | Yes  | Untested  |
|  HTTPS | Yes | Yes  |  Yes|  Untested |


## Example entry for `config.yaml`:
<!--
  Supplying a configuration snippet, makes it easier for a maintainer to test
  your PR. Furthermore, for new integrations, it gives an impression of how
  the configuration would look like.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR does not have an example entry.
-->

# Example config.yaml
```yaml
ota_http:


button:
  - platform: template
    name: "Firmware update"
    on_press:
      then:
        - ota_http.flash:
            url: http://example.com/firmware.bin
        - logger.log: "This message should be not displayed(reboot)"
```

## Checklist:
  - [X] The code change is tested and works locally.
  - [x] Tests have been added to verify that the new code works (under `tests/` folder).

If user exposed functionality or configuration variables are added/changed:
  - [x] Documentation added/updated in [esphome-docs](https://github.com/esphome/esphome-docs).

comment.body:
> @nerijus Previous commit has fixed https for 8266.

So the line "https only supported for esp32" can probably be removed at all?

pull_request.title: Fix HA error related to incorrect state class
pull_request.body:
# What does this implement/fix?

Fixes error in HA logs:

`2023-10-26 15:28:29.297 WARNING (MainThread) [homeassistant.components.sensor] Entity sensor.solar_heat_quantity (<class 'homeassistant.components.esphome.sensor.EsphomeSensor'>) is using state class 'measurement' which is impossible considering device class ('energy') it is using; expected None or one of 'total', 'total_increasing'; Please update your configuration if your entity is manually configured, otherwise create a bug report at https://github.com/home-assistant/core/issues?q=is%3Aopen+is%3Aissue+label%3A%22integration%3A+esphome%22`

## Types of changes

- [x] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Other

- [ ] ESP32 IDF

  Supplying a configuration snippet, makes it easier for a maintainer to test

auto_merge.commit_title: Fix HA error related to incorrect state class (#5605)

issue.title: support spi for sn74hc595
issue.body:
# What does this implement/fix?

Support using SPI for the sn74hc595. This is required when other SPI devices are in the same bus such as by the Shelly Pro 2PM.

## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Other

**Related issue or feature (if applicable):** NA

**Pull request in [esphome-docs](https://github.com/esphome/esphome-docs) with documentation (if applicable):** esphome/esphome-docs#<esphome-docs PR number goes here>

## Test Environment

- [x] ESP32
- [x] ESP32 IDF
- [ ] ESP8266
- [ ] RP2040

## Example entry for `config.yaml`:
<!--
  Supplying a configuration snippet, makes it easier for a maintainer to test
  your PR. Furthermore, for new integrations, it gives an impression of how
  the configuration would look like.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR does not have an example entry.
-->

When using the SPI the following can be used:
```yaml
# Example with SPI
spi:
  clk_pin: GPIO21
  mosi_pin: GPIO22
  miso_pin: GPIO23
sn74hc595:
  - id: sn74hc595_hub_2
    latch_pin: GPIO22
    oe_pin: GPIO32
    sr_count: 2
```

When not using the SPI, the same previous schema works:
```yaml
sn74hc595:
  - id: sn74hc595_hub
    data_pin: GPIO21
    clock_pin: GPIO23
    latch_pin: GPIO22
    oe_pin: GPIO32
    sr_count: 2
```

## Checklist:
  - [x] The code change is tested and works locally.
  - [x] Tests have been added to verify that the new code works (under `tests/` folder).

If user exposed functionality or configuration variables are added/changed:
  - [ ] Documentation added/updated in [esphome-docs](https://github.com/esphome/esphome-docs).

commits.message:
Add dfrobot_sen0395 mmwave radar component (#4203)

Co-authored-by: Jesse Hills <3060199+jesserockz@users.noreply.github.com>

pull_request.title: Add dfrobot_sen0395 mmwave radar component
pull_request.body:
# What does this implement/fix?

Add component for dfrobot mmwave radar which allows easy configuration via settings action and allows to read state via uart.

## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Other

**Related issue or feature (if applicable):** -

**Pull request in [esphome-docs](https://github.com/esphome/esphome-docs) with documentation (if applicable):** esphome/esphome-docs#2554

## Test Environment

- [x] ESP32
- [ ] ESP32 IDF
- [x] ESP8266
- [ ] RP2040

## Example entry for `config.yaml`:
<!--
  Supplying a configuration snippet, makes it easier for a maintainer to test
  your PR. Furthermore, for new integrations, it gives an impression of how
  the configuration would look like.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR does not have an example entry.
-->

```yaml
# Example config.yaml
external_components:
  - source: github://pr#4203
    components: [ dfrobot_mmwave_radar ]

uart:
  - id: uart_mmwave
    tx_pin: 14
    rx_pin: 27
    baud_rate: 115200

dfrobot_mmwave_radar:
    - id: mmwave
      uart_id: uart_mmwave
    # - id: mmwave_2

binary_sensor:
  - platform: dfrobot_mmwave_radar
    name: Mmwave Detected UART

  - platform: gpio
    name: Mmwave Detected GPIO
    device_class: motion
    pin:
      number: 13
      mode: INPUT_PULLDOWN

button:
  - platform: template
    name: "Update Settings"
    on_press:
      # - dfrobot_mmwave_radar.start
      # - dfrobot_mmwave_radar.stop
      # - dfrobot_mmwave_radar.reset
      - dfrobot_mmwave_radar.settings:
          # id: mmwave
          factory_reset: true
          detection_segments:
            - [0cm, 3m]
          output_latency:
            delay_after_detect: 0s
            delay_after_disappear: 0s
          start_after_power_on: true
          turn_on_led: false
          presence_via_uart: true
          sensitivity: 7
```

## Checklist:
  - [x] The code change is tested and works locally.
  - [x] Tests have been added to verify that the new code works (under `tests/` folder).

If user exposed functionality or configuration variables are added/changed:
  - [x] Documentation added/updated in [esphome-docs](https://github.com/esphome/esphome-docs).

pull_request.title: timeout filter: return value
pull_request.body:
# What does this implement/fix?

<!-- Quick description and explanation of changes -->

Instead of calling `this->output(value);` it should be returning the value as the caller of `new_value` will output the new value. 

No change in functionality, just a cleanup of the code.

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)

pull_request.title: Add dfrobot_sen0395 mmwave radar component
pull_request.body:
# What does this implement/fix?

Add component for dfrobot mmwave radar which allows easy configuration via settings action and allows to read state via uart.

## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Other

**Related issue or feature (if applicable):** -

**Pull request in [esphome-docs](https://github.com/esphome/esphome-docs) with documentation (if applicable):** esphome/esphome-docs#2554

## Test Environment

- [x] ESP32
- [ ] ESP32 IDF
- [x] ESP8266
- [ ] RP2040

## Example entry for `config.yaml`:
<!--
  Supplying a configuration snippet, makes it easier for a maintainer to test
  your PR. Furthermore, for new integrations, it gives an impression of how
  the configuration would look like.
  Note: Remove this section if this PR does not have an example entry.
-->

```yaml
# Example config.yaml
external_components:
  - source: github://pr#4203
    components: [ dfrobot_mmwave_radar ]

uart:
  - id: uart_mmwave
    tx_pin: 14
    rx_pin: 27
    baud_rate: 115200

dfrobot_mmwave_radar:
    - id: mmwave
      uart_id: uart_mmwave
    # - id: mmwave_2

binary_sensor:
  - platform: dfrobot_mmwave_radar
    name: Mmwave Detected UART

  - platform: gpio
    name: Mmwave Detected GPIO
    device_class: motion
    pin:
      number: 13
      mode: INPUT_PULLDOWN

button:
  - platform: template
    name: "Update Settings"
    on_press:
      # - dfrobot_mmwave_radar.start
      # - dfrobot_mmwave_radar.stop
      # - dfrobot_mmwave_radar.reset
      - dfrobot_mmwave_radar.settings:
          # id: mmwave
          factory_reset: true
          detection_segments:
            - [0cm, 3m]
          output_latency:
            delay_after_detect: 0s
            delay_after_disappear: 0s
          start_after_power_on: true
          turn_on_led: false
          presence_via_uart: true
          sensitivity: 7
```

## Checklist:
  - [x] The code change is tested and works locally.
  - [x] Tests have been added to verify that the new code works (under `tests/` folder).

If user exposed functionality or configuration variables are added/changed:
  - [x] Documentation added/updated in [esphome-docs](https://github.com/esphome/esphome-docs).

comment.diff_hunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,216 @@
+import esphome.codegen as cg
+import esphome.config_validation as cv
+from esphome import automation
+from esphome import core
+from esphome.automation import maybe_simple_id
+from esphome.const import (
+    CONF_ID,
+)
+from esphome.components import uart
+
+CODEOWNERS = ["@niklasweber"]
+DEPENDENCIES = ["uart"]
+MULTI_CONF = True
+
+dfrobot_sen0395_ns = cg.esphome_ns.namespace("dfrobot_sen0395")
+DfrobotSen0395Component = dfrobot_sen0395_ns.class_(
+    "DfrobotSen0395Component", cg.Component
+)
+
+# Actions
+DfrobotSen0395PowerAction = dfrobot_sen0395_ns.class_(
+    "DfrobotSen0395PowerAction", automation.Action
+)
+DfrobotSen0395ResetAction = dfrobot_sen0395_ns.class_(
+    "DfrobotSen0395ResetAction", automation.Action
+)
+DfrobotSen0395SettingsAction = dfrobot_sen0395_ns.class_(
+    "DfrobotSen0395SettingsAction", automation.Action
+)
+
+CONF_DFROBOT_SEN0395_ID = "dfrobot_sen0395_id"
+
+CONF_DELAY_AFTER_DETECT = "delay_after_detect"
+CONF_DELAY_AFTER_DISAPPEAR = "delay_after_disappear"
+CONF_DETECTION_SEGMENTS = "detection_segments"
+CONF_OUTPUT_LATENCY = "output_latency"
+CONF_START_AFTER_POWER_ON = "start_after_power_on"
+CONF_TURN_ON_LED = "turn_on_led"
comment.body: Ah yes I removed them from the settings action

issue.title: timeout filter: return value
issue.body:
# What does this implement/fix?

<!-- Quick description and explanation of changes -->

Instead of calling `this->output(value);` it should be returning the value as the caller of `new_value` will output the new value. 

No change in functionality, just a cleanup of the code.

## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Other

Hey there @esphome/core, mind taking a look at this pull request as it has been labeled with an integration (`sensor`) you are listed as a [code owner](https://github.com/esphome/esphome/blob/dev/CODEOWNERS#L262) for? Thanks!

pull_request.title: timeout filter: return value
pull_request.body:
# What does this implement/fix?

<!-- Quick description and explanation of changes -->

Instead of calling `this->output(value);` it should be returning the value as the caller of `new_value` will output the new value. 

No change in functionality, just a cleanup of the code.

## Types of changes

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to not work as expected)
- [ ] Other
